#summary How to get started
#labels Featured

Actually Piriti consists of these sub projects:
  * [Features Piriti-Core]: The core classes to map JSON and XML to POJOs and vice versa.
  * [RestletExtension Piriti-Restlet]: An extension for the Restlet GWT edition. Contains representations which use the readers from Piriti Core. 

= Prerequisites =
To use Piriti make sure you have the following dependencuies on your classpath:
  * [http://code.google.com/webtoolkit/ GWT 2.2] or better
  * [http://code.google.com/p/google-gin/ GIN 1.5] or better
  * [http://code.google.com/p/google-guice/ Guice 3.0] or better
  * [http://code.google.com/p/totoe/ Totoe 0.2.4] or better
  
For maven users just add the following repositories to your pom and you're done (the repositories contain all necessary dependencies):
{{{
<repository>
    <id>pehl-parent</id> 
    <url>http://pehl-parent.googlecode.com/svn/repository</url>
</repository>
<repository>
    <id>totoe-repo</id>
    <name>Totoe Repository</name>
    <url>http://totoe.googlecode.com/svn/repository</url>
</repository>
<repository>
    <id>piriti-repo</id>
    <name>Piriti Repository</name>
    <url>http://piriti.googlecode.com/svn/repository</url>
</repository>
}}}

Then depending on how much functionality you need add the following dependencies to your pom:
{{{
<dependency>
    <groupId>name.pehl.piriti</groupId>
    <artifactId>piriti-core</artifactId>
    <scope>provided</scope>
</dependency>
<!-- For Restlet support -->
<dependency>
    <groupId>name.pehl.piriti</groupId>
    <artifactId>piriti-restlet</artifactId>
    <scope>provided</scope>
</dependency>
}}}

= Modules =
To actually use Piriti make sure that you inherit one or all of the following modules:
{{{
<inherits name="name.pehl.piriti.json.JSON" />
<inherits name="name.pehl.piriti.xml.XML" />
}}}
